result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Bruce Rice Vincent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Rock County Ordinance - Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Bruce Rice Vincent

records.addlTxt: Order to return seized weapon
Proposed Order to Return Seized Weapon

3:23 PM Defendant Christopher Bruce Rice-Vincent in court.  Attorney Joshua Patrick Grube in court for Christopher Bruce Rice-Vincent.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.  State orally amends charge to County ordinance. State to file an amended complaint to forfeiture. Defendant pleads no contest to amended charge. Court finds the defendant guilty and orders a fine of $50 and costs due within 60 days. Court orders weapon seized in this matter to be returned to the defendant.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

08:50 AM Defendant Christopher Bruce Rice Vincent in court by video.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent and appoints attorney Joshua Grube. Defendant to reimburse the County $100 per month.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Indigency hearing on May 18, 2022 at 08:45 am.
